JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: The first applicant , PERSON , was born in DATE and lives in LOC . The second and third applicants , PERSON and PERSON , were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in LOC . The fourth applicant , PERSON , was born in DATE and lives in GPE . All the applicants are NORP nationals and were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

By virtue of a binding judgment of ORG dated DATE , ORG of GPE , ORG and several private persons were ordered to pay the applicants pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages for the harm caused by the deaths of their husbands , who had drowned in a shipwreck on DATE .

The judgment debt consisted of payments in the form of a lump sum and DATE allowances , the latter obligation arising with effect from DATE . The practical arrangements for payment of the judgment debt were not specified .

On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicants complained to ORG of ORG that they had not received their allowance for DATE ; the corresponding arrears amounted to CARDINAL United States dollars ( ORG ) ( CARDINAL euros ( ORG ) ) .

In a reply of CARDINAL DATE ORG , officially classifying the applicants’ case as of high importance , pledged to undertake specific enforcement measures with the aim of paying the above - mentioned arrears without delay .
